meanings.definition: A soft-bodied invertebrate animal with a muscular foot, a mantle, and a shell.
meanings.sent1: The molluscs in the ocean have shells to protect themselves.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study different types of molluscs to learn about their habitats.
meanings.sent3: The molluscs decided to have a race to see who could find the biggest shell.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a colorful mollusc, always coming up with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the molluscs they found at the beach.

meanings.definition: Any member of the phylum Mollusca, including snails, slugs, octopuses, and squids.
meanings.sent1: Molluscs like snails and squids are part of the diverse marine ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium had a special exhibit featuring various molluscs.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious dish using molluscs as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a mess, with clothes scattered everywhere like a group of unruly molluscs.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful mural depicting colorful molluscs underwater.
